properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:25 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing damaging wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-04T11:23:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T08:25:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2313942072.2020
Area: R.M. of Sifton incl. Oak Lake and Deleau, R.M. of Pipestone incl. Oak Lake Res., Mun. of Grassland incl. Hartney and Minto, Mun. of Two Borders incl. Melita Coulter and Tilston, Mun. of Brenda-Waskada incl. Medora and Goodlands, Mun. of Deloraine-Winchester
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:26 a.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-04T11:25:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T08:26:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0427330587.2020
Area: R.M. of Wallace-Woodworth incl. Virden Elkhorn and Kenton, R.M. of Sifton incl. Oak Lake and Deleau, R.M. of Pipestone incl. Oak Lake Res., Mun. of Grassland incl. Hartney and Minto, Mun. of Two Borders incl. Melita Coulter and Tilston, Mun. of Brenda-Waskada incl. Medora and Goodlands, R.M. of Riding Mountain West incl. Asessippi Prov. Park, Mun. of Russell-Binscarth incl. Gambler Res., R.M.of Ellice-Archie incl. St-Lazare McAuley and Manson, Prairie View Mun. incl. Birdtail Sioux Res.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable late this evening for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-07-04T09:59:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T02:24:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0320076968.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms continue over south-eastern Saskatchewan tonight and are gradually moving towards the east and northeast. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-04T12:19:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T08:22:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3937592131.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms have developed over south-central Saskatchewan along a trough of low pressure and are gradually moving towards the east and northeast. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe this evening or overnight. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-04T10:00:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T05:03:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2094899163.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Scattered thunderstorms will continue to move through the region this evening, some of which may approach severe limits. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-04T08:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T04:03:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2820494113.2020
Area: Thebacha Region including Ft. Smith - Salt River Reserve
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:15 a.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. The severe thunderstorm is located 20 km north of Jenner and is moving northeast at 45 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-04T10:14:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-04T07:16:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1933238915.2020
Area: S.A. 3 near Big Stone Cappon and Gold Spur
properties.Author: Environment Canada

Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:01 a.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing damaging wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. These thunderstorms are located along a line from Estevan to 20 km east of Weyburn to 10 km east of Griffin to 20 km southwest of Grenville and is moving towards the east at 35 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-04T08:54:05-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Severe thunderstorms are pushing into Manitoba from Saskatchewan early this morning. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-04T14:22:42-00:00
